results.title: Migration: the decision to migrate
results.creator_credit: Educational Media Australia and Ken J. Widdowson
results.brief_description: The first of a three part program which traces a Finnish family from its initial decision to emigrate to Australia, probes their reactions to living in Australia, and finally explains why the family prepare to return to Finland after 18 months in Australia. This filmed interview looks at the lifestyle of the family in Finland and their reasons for migrating. Their reasons range from undisclosed personal considerations to the feeling that personal freedom and initiative have declined in Finland and that life in Australia will provide better opportunities for their children.

results.title: Migration: after eighteen months (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Educational Media Australia and Ken J. Widdowson
results.brief_description: This is the last film about the Rata family and their emigration from Finland to Australia. It looks at the occurrences of the 18 months stay and the reasons leading to the family’s decision to return home to Finland. It contrasts their expectations with the reality of living in Australia.

results.title: Migrating forms [DVD]
results.brief_description: Imagine that New York photographer Cindy Sherman and David Lynch met in a dark alley and decided to collaborate on a project, filmed on 16mm in black and white, with a mono soundtrack. Are you there yet? If so, then welcome to the world of 23-year-old Chicago native James Fotopoulos. “Migrating forms” is the story of a man and a woman conducting a tawdry affair under the watchful eye of his cat. The woman, who reaches out to him emotionally, discovers a cyst on her back. The man, who seeks the gratification of another, rejects her, whilst developing his own cyst. Fotopoulus presents a palette of unrelenting dark and grotty spaces, burgeoning with sinister possibilities and thwarted dreams. His experimental, minimalist cinema despondently explores the spaces of the physical and psychological consequences of sex. This avant-garde, experimental, abstract work of haunting qualities is bleak, austere and disturbing in its evocation of anti-eroticism. Winner of Best Feature award at the 2000 New York Underground Film Festival. Features scenes of full frontal male and female nudity. Cast includes Rebecca Lewis and Preston Baty. Original Music by Tom Nicholl.

results.title: Mighty like a moose
results.creator_credit: Hal Roach Studios and Leo McCarey
results.brief_description: A hilarious Charley Chase comedy that revolves around Mr and Mrs Moose, not the best-looking couple in town. He (Charley Chase) gets his teeth fixed and she (Vivien Oakland) gets her nose lifted. They both look great - so great that when they meet accidentally, they don’t recognise each other and plan an illicit rendezvous. Also stars Ann Howe, Charles Clary, Gale Henry and Malcolm Denny.

results.title: Mighty Joe Young
results.creator_credit: Argosy Pictures, Arko Productions, RKO Radio Pictures, John Ford, Merian C. Cooper and Ernest B Schoedsack
results.brief_description: Following in the footsteps of King Kong, this is a fantasy story about another giant ape by the name of Joe Young, his devoted owner Jill Young (Terry Moore) and the exploitation Joe Young suffers when he is taken from his native country of Africa back to America and the bright lights of Hollywood. Cast also includes Ben Johnson and Robert Armstrong.

results.title: Miffy: best friends are great
results.creator_credit: Kodansha, Dick Bruna, Japan Inc, Mercis Media, Yuzuru Otagawa, Yukiko Omura, Yoshimasa Mizou and Toshio Nishiuchi
results.brief_description: The stories of Miffy and her friends have enchanted and entertained young children for many years. Based on Dick Bruna’s children’s books, this video provides a safe and caring environment where children can discover and explore a wide range of emotions. The following 10 episodes are included: Best friends are great; Miffy’s magnifying glass; Snip with scissors; Who are you?; Like or not?; What’s behind the door?; Hide and seek; Somehow different; Same or different?; Big or small?

results.title: Miffy at the zoo
results.creator_credit: Hertogenbosch, Meulenoff, Kodansha, Hilversham, Palm Plus and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: Miffy, Dick Bruna’s lovable white rabbit is off to the zoo with her father. They travel by train and see lots of animals. The seven other stories are: 1. The Christmas book. - 2. The Circus. - 3. Another story to tell. - 4. Miffy at the playground. - 5. Snuffy’s puppies. - 6. The Fish. - 7. Poppy pig. The bold colours and solid shapes of the illustrations, accompanied by simple but entertaining stories make this highly suitable for young children.

results.title: Miffy at the hospital
results.brief_description: Based on the delightful children’s books by Dick Bruna about Miffy, the white rabbit, this tape includes 8 adventures with Miffy including: The Orchestra- Miffy at the hospital- Poppy’s birthday- The School- The Little Bird- Cinderella- Red Riding Hood and The Apple. Suitable for young children.

results.title: Miffy
results.creator_credit: Hertogenbosch, Meulenoff, Kodansha, Hilvershum, Palm Plus and Gene Deitch
results.brief_description: Miffy is a familiar friend to generations of very young children. Together with Snuffy, Farmer John, Poppy Pig, Boris and Barbara, she features in the family of characters from Dick Bruna’s much loved children’s books. These simple yet captivating stories will take children into the delightful world of Miffy and her friends. 1-Miffy 2-Miffy’s bicycle 3-Miffy at school 4-I Know about numbers 5-Miffy goes flying 6-Farmer John 7-Miffy’s dream 8-Snuffy.
